item.title: My first blog post!
item.description: Hello! If you haven’t been able to tell by the website already, my name is Paul Hook. I am a fourth year Ph.D. student in the Human Genetics program in the McKusick-Nathans Institute of Genetic Medicine at the Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. You can learn alittle bit more about me here, so I won’t go on and on in the inaugural blog post. One of the reasons I was driven to create a website/blog was the blog of one of my former Human Genetics program-mates, Shannon Ellis.

item.title: about
item.description: My name is Paul Hook. I am a fourth year Ph.D. student in the Human Genetics program in the McKusick-Nathans Institute of Genetic Medicine at the Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. I am in Dr. Andy McCallion’s lab and I am currently working on trying to elucidate the genetics that underlie Parkinson disease and other complex neurological disorders. I am especially interested in non-coding DNA and gene regulation. I have recently realized I enjoy sifting through big datasets and spending hours trying to make the perfect figures in R.

item.title: contact
item.description: Email me: phook2 [at] jhmi.edu I’m on Twitter: @paul_hook_HuGen Find my code and analyses on Github Check me out on Google Scholar

item.title: papers
item.description: Grad school Preprints Single-cell RNA-seq of mouse dopaminergic neurons informs candidate gene selection for sporadic Parkinson’s disease. Paul W. Hook, Sarah A. McClymont, Gabrielle H. Cannon, William D. Law, A. Jennifer Morton, Loyal A. Goff, Andrew S. McCallion. bioRxiv 148049; doi: 10.1101/148049 Github: https://github.com/pwh124/sc-da-parkinsons Website: https://pwh124.github.io/sc-da-parkinsons/ 2018 2016 Turner, T.N., Hormozdiari, F., Duyzend, M.H., McClymont, S.A., Hook, P.W., Iossifov, I., Raja, A., Baker, C., Hoekzema, K.

item.title: projects
item.description: Single-cell RNA-seq of dopaminergic neurons Github: https://github.com/pwh124/sc-da-parkinsons This Gitub repo contains code for analyses and figures associated with Hook, et al., 2018 Website: https://pwh124.github.io/sc-da-parkinsons/ I created this website from the Github repo above using the workflowr package. I wanted to create this website so that my data would be more accessible and reproducible. Single-cell gene expression R Shiny App Github: https://github.com/pwh124/th-expression-shiny Website: https://pwh124.shinyapps.io/expressionshiny/ I got the bug to create a Shiny App in an attempt to mirror some of the websites made for various other single-cell RNA-seq projects.
